description: From the ending of the words quintuple, sextuple; from Latin -plus.

entries.meaning: (set theory) A finite sequence of terms.
examples: Hyponyms: (n terms) n-tuple, (two terms) ordered pair, (three terms) triple, triplet

entries.meaning: (databases) A single row in a relational database.
(computing) A set of comma-separated values passed to a program or operating system as a parameter to a function call.
(programming) A fixed-size container data type similar to a list that can hold different types of elements.
examples: Both Python and Haskell have a tuple data type as well as a list data type.
Unlike lists, tuples are not formed by consing.
